name: A & B Package Variety
notes: standard issue deli turkey club. roll a tad dry.

name: ACE Sushi
notes: adequate grocery store sushi, spicy sauce shines over slighty mushy tuna.

name: Aegean Breeze
notes: soft pita featuring flat meat, but cohesive flavors.

name: AFC Sushi
notes: adequate grocery store sushi. salmon slightly better than tuna. i have doubts this is the best-selling item.

name: Agaves
notes: it sizzled and steamed and was enough for two people.

name: Aroma Bar and Grill
notes: tender chicken, creamy sauce, very orange, lots of rice. but now takeout only.

name: Ayakito Japanese Kitchen
notes: soft and fluffy rice with a little bit of tuna and mayo in the center..

name: Azteca Taqueria
notes: literally bursting beef and bean burrito, a tad mealy the meat, decent flavor.

name: Backstage Grille
notes: a mound of tots with a side of burger, patty was meh, tots were on point. go for the bowling.

name: Barrington Brewery & Restaurant
notes: my daughter said the chair was uncomfortable. nevertheless, the fish had a nice fry, plus they have house-brewed beer.

name: Bear Butter
notes: a bit of everything; sweet, crunchy, salty, tart.

name: Berkshire Food Coop
notes: lightly toasted bread, sprouts and avocado balance out turkey and bacon.

name: Berkshire Mountain Bakery
notes: a nice crunchy crust and good flavors. minus ten points since i had to bake it myself.

name: Big Y World Class Market
notes: a meaty threesome, tasted like a knock-off sandwich from subway.

name: Bistro Box
notes: juicy burger with big flavor, bacon jam rocks.

name: Bizalion's Fine Food
notes: nothing clever to say, just a solid sandwich with good ingredients.

name: Bizen Gourmet Japanese Restaurant
notes: refusing to accept that their most expensive item—chillean sea bass—was their most popular, i ordered the runner-up. the fish was good, the rest was okay.

name: Bogies
notes: it's hard to enjoy a burger when you know there is a better burger less than 100 yards away. the fries were good.

name: Cafe Adam
notes: aside from a good portion, it didn't give me what i needed at that price.

name: Cafe Holli
notes: an on-the-go spartan breakfast sandwich on an english muffin. eggs remained fluffy despite hanging out pre-made in a heated case.

name: Common or Garden Pub
notes: solid big mac-esque burger. fries meh. good for watching football, or football.

name: Cumberland Farms
notes: cumby's pizza was...good. soft crust like a warm hug. not overly greasy. a whopping 680 calories, but i still might be back to dine on the angus burger.

name: Dunkin' Donuts
notes: the speedy preparation was too good to be true, as i bit into an unexpectedly cold slice of cheese.

name: East Asian Cuisine
notes: the steamed broccoli was a nice counterpoint to the very fried, very sweet-sauced chicken. the space is huge.

name: Elm
notes: the quintessential fancy bar burger. quite tasty. didn't care for the modern country music.

name: Extra Special Teas 2
notes: the delightful side salad was the star here. need to try the breakfast situation.

name: Fairview Hospital
notes: today, a taste of poland. tommorrow, who knows? as incubus once said, whatever tomorrow brings, I'll be there.

name: Farm Country Soup
notes: pretty yummy, very cheesy. also had a lentil soup which was nice.

name: Fiddleheads Grille
notes: i didn't expect fish and chips to be a regional delicacy in the deep south of great barrington. and yes, fiddleheads is in great barrington.

name: Fiesta Bar and Grill
notes: crispy tortilla filled with stuff. the rice and beans were on point.

name: Four Brother's Pizza
notes: i didn't see them, but i like to think that the four toppings were each placed by one of the four brothers, and represent who they are. good crust, very cheesy.

name: Fuel
notes: a fine sandwich. chicken a tad dry. good homemade chips.

name: GB Eats
notes: i think the only place you can get breakfast for dinner in town? the poached eggs were pillowy.

name: Great Barrington Bagel Company
notes: a utilitarian breakfast sandwich. a little bland, but got a free cup of joe.

name: Great Barrington Little League Snack Bar
notes: i don't think this counts, but I couldn't resist a room temp sllce from Big Y, plus a free kids baseball game

name: Great Barrington Pizza House
notes: four unique meats wasn't enough to overcome the colossus of cheese. come here to support big dairy.

name: Great Wall Chinese Food
notes: it tasted exactly like my childhood chinese restaurant, so bonus points for nostalgia. veggies were scarce, but flavor was there. the piles of boxes in the kitchen was a little disconcerting.

name: Guido's Fresh Marketplace
notes: a comforting sandwich, but lacked pizazz. some hot sauce and salt improved things.

name: Ilse coffee
notes: it's only been open two days but they make a deliciously fluffy egg cube. a bit pricey.

name: JuJu's
notes: a good fried chicken with some yummy sauces. but it was literally just chicken so i had to have some soft serve to make it nutritionally complete.

name: Koii Asian Gourmet
notes: dissapointingly chewy chicken. breaking my own rules based on other dishes i've had to move this from a no to a maybe.

name: Los Lopez Taco Truck
notes: juicy, flavorful meat on a hot corn tortilla.

name: Manhattan Pizza
notes: a solid pie, best fresh out of the oven. the small was large. i've noticed that people love the multi-meat meals.

name: Market 32
notes: $9.99/lb. with no hesitation the popular items were burnt ends, lo mein, and chicken wings. burnt end gave microwave meat vibes. wings were on point.

name: Marketplace Kitchen Table
notes: i didn't expect this to be the pick. a satisfying panini, though I feel strongly that lettuce has no place on a hot pressed sandwich.

name: Marketplace Specialty Shop
notes: just like a deli sandwich i would have made for myself for school lunch, down to the pepperidge farm sliced bread.

name: McDonald's
notes: my excitement about my first visit to mickey d's in 15 years dissipated faster than my order was done (insanely fast). either my taste has changed or the quality has dropped, or both.

name: Mill River Farm
notes: fine, missing a little something though

name: Momma Lo's BBQ
notes: good stuff. reasonable price.

name: Myat Naing Sushi
notes: best grocery store sushi game in town. pretty good.

name: No Comply Foods
notes: i'm a bit burned out on burgers, but this rekindled the romance with the jalapeno relish and pickled onion. gold star for tip included.

name: Number Ten
notes: pricey, but tasty. not the speediest service. they have all the fancy meats.

name: Odd Bird Farm Bakery
notes: this will fill you up. fluffly eggs, flaky biscuit (a touch too salty for me). best spot in town if need a 6am breakfast sandwich. carry-out only.

name: Off The Shelf Farm
notes: slightly runny egg sandwich with flavorful onion jam and fresh arugula

name: Pattiserie Lenox
notes: very good sandwich. baguette was crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. sticker shock though.

name: Pixie Boulangerie
notes: room temp meat isn't necessarily my thing, but it was pretty good, flaky crust. i'd need a few to fill me up.

name: Pleasant and Main
notes: the meal gave me diner energy. i was only charged $10 on account of my sunny disposition.

name: Prairie Whale
notes: actually the "vermount cattlemen grass-fed cheeseburger." it was good, but the most expensive burger in town it doesn't live up to the price tag. very good fries though.

name: Robbie's Community Market
notes: sandwich component quality was inconsistent. vibes were nice. one area was infested with babies.

name: Rubi's Cafe
notes: a lovely grilled cheese that comes with a side of second-hand smoke from lack of ventilation.

name: Siam Square
notes: it came out faster than my big mac (not a good thing). a bit too sweet, chicken kind of rubbery.

name: Steam Noodle Cafe
notes: disclaimer: i had to get takeout since it was crokinole night. a nice steamy soup, good flavor. felt a little swollen after.

name: Subway
notes: i opted for the 6 inch on the comforting italian herb and cheese. despite suspect chicken, you throw enough ranch on something and it improves.

name: Taft Farms
notes: not the speediest during the lunch rush. a monster of sandwich, intended to induce a thanksgiving-esque coma. pretty tasty, except the bread was a little dry.

name: Uva Pizza
notes: it was fine, but the more i ate it the less impressed i was, especially for the price.

name: Vivaldi's Pizzeria
notes: $4.49/slice. very economical. biggest slice in town by far, if that's your thing. good crust but not my ideal cheese to sauce ratio.

name: Well
notes: the doubled-up patty was filling. it tasted like an elevated big mac.
